channel.title: [free] Will make clients using soulscape for free :)
channel.description:
I will make clients using soulscape for free. Like changing backgrounds, colors of the loading bar, Username: Password: etc.
Reply on this post in this format:
Servername: your 'scape Background: what you want in the background ;) Coloring: pick two colors for what you want for the loading bar and what you want for the text... Username: etc.. Port change?: if you want a different port than 43594.
------ I will not be programming any extra things into this client. I am only recoloring and backgrounding and port changing... :)

jesus fucking christ people, you wouldn’t do

return new URL("http://" + 127.0.0.1 + ":" + (80 + anInt958));

would you!
you’d do

return new URL("http://127.0.0.1:" + (80 + anInt958));

[/quote]
i suppose 80 would be port 80??[/quote]

yes, but thats not the port your looking for

item.title: [free] Will make clients using soulscape for free :)
item.dc:creator: @macintoshosx macintoshosx
item.description:
@macintoshosx wrote:

You have to have the + signs around the serverip or it won’t work.
i.e. return new URL(“http://”+serverip+":" + (80 + anInt958));

Read full topic

item.source: [free] Will make clients using soulscape for free :)

item.title: [free] Will make clients using soulscape for free :)
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

Change the Loading bar:

  1. Open up client.java

  2. Search for 8C1111 there is only 2 places and both you can edit for this. The first one you find is for the frame and the second one is for the loading bar.

  3. Chage it to a hex code you want. Example for purple it will be 0xBD04EB instead of 0x8C1111. So write the hex code after the 0x.

Change the background image:

This ones a sexy one.

You may or may not know, but the background image is actually 1 image, flipped over and copied.

IE, the image is only actually half. This means it only takes half the time to render the flames.

So your image will be a duplicate <3

If you can search through your file, then do so, look for “jpg”
And in Class50_Sub1_Sub1_Sub’s loader method (public Class50_Sub1_Sub1_Sub3(byte abyte0[], Component component)

You get this:
System.out.println(“Error converting jpg”);

Which means, its loading a jpg!

Well, look up, and wow, an image.

Code:

Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().createImage(abyte0);

If you know your java, that means its loading the image from a byte array - loaded through the .dat files (see my other post for dumping/load them)

So, we just swap it! EASY.

Make your background image, 383x503 pixels, if you want, make it look good when flipped. (You may be able to use other sizes, I havn’t tried, dunno what will happen!)
Maybe you’ll just get one flame on the left if you double the width, give it a go - and let us know!

Save it somewhere, I saved mine in “\bin\data\db.jpg”, so I swapped for this:
Code:

Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage(System.getProperty(“user.dir”) + “\BIN\DATA\bg.jpg”);

You need the double 's because without them… it wont work

To make a client login to a specific server, just search for

public final URL getCodeBase()

And change:

                return new URL("http://"+aString1174+":" + (80 + anInt958));

To:

                return new URL("http://"serverip":" + (80 + anInt958));

Read full topic
item.source: [free] Will make clients using soulscape for free :)
